title: Orange Chicken (Hello Fresh)
directions: In a small pot, combine rice, 2 1/4 cups of water, and a pinch of salt. Brint to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until tender, 15 - 18 minutes.
Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.
Zest orange until you have 2 tsp. Halve oranges. Sweeze juice from both halves into a small bowl.
Pat chicken dry with paper towels. Dice into 1" pieces.
In a large bowl, whick together tempura mix, 2/3 cup of water, and salt until smooth. Add water if mixture is too thick.
Stir chicken into batter until fully coated.
To bowl with orange juice, add sweet soy glaze, chili sauce, jam stock concentrate, orange zest, vinegar, 2 tbsp water, 2 tsp cornstarch, and 8 tsp sugar.
Heat a medium, dry pan over medium-high heat. Pour in orange sauce. Cook until slightly thickened, 3 - 4 minutes. Remove pan from heat.

Heat a 1/3" layer of oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pan over medium-high heat. Once oil is hot enough that a drop of batter sizzles when added to the pan, working in batches if necessary, carefully add coated chicken in a single layer. Cook until groden brown on first side, 3- 5 minutes. Using tongs, flip and cook until chicken is golden brown and cooked through, 4 - 5 minutes more.
Using tongs or a slotted spoon, transfer chicken to a paper-towel-lined plate. Immediately season lightly with salt and pepper.
Add tempura chicken and half the scallions to pan with sauce. Reheat over medium heat, stirring, until chicken is glazed, 1 - 2 minutes. If sauce is too thick, add a splash of water.
Fluff rice with a fork. Divide between plates. Top with orange chicken and any remaining sauce from pan. Garnish with remaining scallions and serve.
